comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
What about this issue? I remember Hamilton mentioning on the devel group that he thinks this issue is not worth the hassle. Since in general it is unfixable, and per specific implementation this can be alleviated with an interceptor, shall we close it?
I think adding a good sample and a warning in the docs about it (with suggestion to use interceptor) is a good enough solution

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I think as we once decided on the list that we can't fix it in 100% anyway to just drop the feature.
